metadata.title: CVE-2016-4491 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: The d_print_comp function in cp-demangle.c in libiberty allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted binary, which triggers infinite recursion and a buffer overflow, related to a node having "itself as ancestor more than once."

criterions.comment: binutils package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.29-1ubuntu1').
binutils-h8300-hms package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-h8300-hms package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
gdb package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0-0ubuntu3').
ht package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0+repack1-1').
nescc package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
valgrind package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu2').
